channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Hong Kong’s Same-Sex Rights Bill Meets Rare Defiance From Lawmakers
item.description: Legislators could sink a government proposal that would give some rights to couples who married overseas, raising questions about the city’s status as...

item.title: Inside Jeffrey Epstein’s 50th Birthday Book
item.description: A Times investigation looked into how the disgraced financier leveraged his rich and powerful friends.

item.title: How Gen Z Protests Overturned a Government, and a Crackdown on TV Drug Ads
AI for chemistry startup CuspAI raises $100 million in new venture capital funding
item.description: The round, which values CuspAI at a reported $520 million, is being led by NEA and Temasek, with Nvidia's NVentures, Samsung, and Hyundai Motor Group ...

item.title: Poland Says It Shot Down Russian Drones That Entered Its Airspace
item.description: The Polish military called the incursions an “act of aggression.” Poland and NATO air forces launched warplanes to respond, the Polish military said.

item.title: Israel’s Attack on Qatari Soil Leads Gulf Powers to Question U.S. Protection
item.description: The audacious attempt to kill the political leaders of Hamas in Doha could upend the foundations of an American-led order in the Middle East.

item.title: Twilio CEO interviews candidates for 45 minutes over dinner—he’s listening for one word in particular, and you’re not hired if you say it too much
item.description: If you say “I” too much in the interview you don’t get the job, the CEO of the $16 billion tech company Twilio tells Fortune.

item.description: The Polish military called the incursions an “act of aggression.” Poland and NATO air forces launched warplanes to respond, the Polish military said.

item.title: Nepali Troops Move to Restore Order as Death Toll Rises to 22
item.description: Protesters defied a curfew to set fire to government buildings and the homes of politicians as unrest over censorship and economic issues continued.

item.title: Israel’s Attack on Hamas in Qatar: What to Know
item.description: Why did Israel attack? Who was killed? What has been the Qatari response? Here are answers to those and other key questions.

item.title: I went from side-hustling to running a $27 million-a-year marketing agency that works with MrBeast: Here’s my most important investment
item.description: The millennial CEO's best advice for his 20-year-old self? “Don’t try to start a business with just interns.”

item.title: Millions of Gen Z are jobless yet they’re ghosting employers—experts say voice notes are the cure to their phone anxiety

item.title: Salomon’s Gen X exec starts his day with caffeine and skiing, before heading to the office at noon: ‘A routine I’ve stuck to for over 25 years’
